content: The Act titled "Continued Participation Pension Act of 1996" allows certain individuals to continue participating in defined benefit plans under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Continued Participation Pension Act of 1996 allows qualified beneficiaries to continue accruing benefits in a defined benefit plan after a qualifying event. This provision ensures that participants do not incur a break in service. This Act applies to plan years starting on or after July 1, 1996, with a special rule for defined benefit plans under collective bargaining agreements ratified before the Act's enactment, exempting them until the termination of agreements or January 1, 2000.
